data.text:
Courteney Bass Cox, better known as Courteney Cox, is an American producer, director, and actor. Courteney Cox has a net worth of $160 million as of 2024. Her most well-known role was Monica Geller in the NBC comedy “Friends,” which aired from 1994 to 2004. She was nominated for seven Screen Actor Guild Awards for “Friends,” of which she was the recipient of one.

Her roles in “Scream” as Gale Weathers, “Family Ties” as Lauren Miller, “Dirt” as Lucy Spiller, “Cougar Town” as Jules Cobb, and numerous other films have also made her well-known. She has acted in movies such as “Masters of the Universe,” “Ace Ventura: Pet Detective,” “Barnyard,” “Bedtime Stories,” “Mothers and Daughters,” and many more in addition to these television shows.

Courteney Cox Biography

Courteney Cox was born on June 15, 1964, and as of 2024, she will be 59 years old. She was born into a prosperous Birmingham, Alabama, family in the United States. She is of English descent, belongs to the American nationality, and practices Christianity.

She attended Mountain Brook High School to finish her education. She continued her schooling at Mount Vernon College in Washington, D.C., where she was enrolled in an architectural program. However, she dropped out in the middle to focus on her acting and modeling careers.

Family, Husband and Relationships

Richard Lewis Cox and Courteney Bass are Courteney Cox’s parents. Richard Lewis Cox is the businessman who is Courteney Cox’s father.

Courteney Bass, a homemaker, is the mother of Courteney Cox. Following the divorce of their parents in 1974, Courteney Copeland wed Hunter Copeland, a well-known business manager and music promoter.

She has three siblings as well. Her older siblings are Virginia McFerrin, a researcher, and Dottie Pickett, a blogger. Her older brother is Richard Jr., who is currently Senior Vice President and Chief Information Officer at Cox Enterprises.

Cox is not married. He is divorced. David Arquette, an American actor, producer, director, fashion designer, and professional wrestler, is her husband.

The couple, who were married on June 12, 1999, at San Francisco’s Grace Cathedral, had a daughter named Coco.

That being said, in May 2013, the couple formally filed for divorce after separating.

The music agent Ian Copeland and Cox were romantically involved from 1984 to 1986. Afterwards, she dated costume designer Paul Brown from June 1987 to January 1989. She later dated Michael Keaton, the actor best known for playing Batman, from 1989 to 1995. There were rumors that she was seeing Kevin Costner.

She also dated Adam Duritz for a short while in 1997. From June to October of 2013, she dated her co-star from “Cougar Town,” Brian Van Holt.

After six months of courting, Cox became engaged to singer and actor Johnny McDaid in June 2014. They called their quits after about 18 months, but they reconciled once more by the spring of 2016 and are still happy together.

Career

Cox began her professional life in the American modeling world. She played Bunny in a ‘As the World Turns’ episode in 1984. She also made an appearance this year as a young woman singing in Bruce Springsteen’s “Dancing in the Dark” music video.

She played Amy, a flight attendant, in two of the “Code Name: Foxfire” television series’ episodes in 1985. She played Gloria Dinallo, the lead character, in 16 episodes of the television series “Misfits of Science” from 1985 to 1986.

She played Tarah in the movie “Down Twisted” and Julie Winston in “Masters of the Universe” in 1987. She played Hana Wysocki in “If It’s Tuesday, It Must Be Belgium” and Nora Bundy in “I’ll Be Home For Christmas” this year, two TV movies. She played Lauren Miller in 19 recurring episodes of the television series “Family Ties” from 1987 to 1989.

She played Sara in the 1988 motion picture “Cocoon: The Return.” She portrayed Jacquie Kimberley in the 1989 TV movie Roxanne: The Prize Pulitzer and appeared in two “Till We Meet Again” episodes as Marie-Frederique or Fredy de Lancel.

She played Jewel Jagger in the movie “Mr. Destiny” and Kathleen in “Shaking the Tree” in 1990. She also portrayed Gwen in the television movie “Curiosity Kills” this year. She portrayed Lisa Roberts in the 1991 film “Blue Desert.” She also played Princess Lucy in an episode of the television show “Morton & Hayes” this year.

She played Carrie Davenport in the 1992 film “The Opposite Sex and How to Live with Them.” She starred as Katherine in the TV movie “Battling for Baby” and as Alisha in an episode of the show “Dream On” this year. She performed as Gabriella Easden in seven episodes of the 1993 television series “The Trouble with Larry” in 1993.

She played Beth in the 2016 motion picture “Mothers and Daughters.” This year, she starred as Hailey in the unsold pilot “Charity Chase” and served as its executive producer. She also played herself in a “Running Wild with Bear Grylls” episode of the show that same year.

She played herself in episodes of three different TV shows in 2017: “Who Do You Think You Are?,” “Off Camera With Sam Jones,” and “The Gong Show.”

Courteney Cox Net Worth Summary

Courteney Cox has a net worth of $160 million as of 2024. Being the second wealthiest performer among the group of “Friends,” she primarily makes her money from TV work, series roles, and film ventures.
